txt.en: 'Hail! I am Gimli, son of Glóin, of Durin's Folk.'
'Hail to you, Gimli of Durin's Folk. I am Spakorth of the Stout-axes!'
'I am one of many servants to the Mistress of Lûghash, and I come bearing an offer of peace between our Houses.'
'Do you speak for this Mistress of Lûghash or for the Stout-axes?'
'I will not protest, Gimli, but one of us must return to Díngarth and keep watch on Dor Amarth.'
'I speak only for my kin, and they desire to be free of the Mistress's rule!'
'We wish only to rule ourselves once more! Will you aid us?'
'It is a fair question, Gimli. Words alone do not merit much, but we seek only for peace and to be free of evil.'
'Nonsense! They did not do so willingly, Legolas!'
'You served Sauron, did you not? How can we trust your words?'
'By Durin's Beard, I swear your folk shall be free once more!'
